name: Path T
title: Pathological T
notes:
**Note 1:**  TNM does not include a Tis or TX category for melanoma of mucosa of head and neck sites. Tis and TX are mapped to NA and TNM stage group is derived as NA.

**Note 2:**  TNM does not include a T1 or T2 category for mucosal melanoma of head and neck sites.

**Note 3:**  Assign T3 for extension involving the mucosa only of adjacent sites.  Assign T4a or T4b for extension involving the deeper tissues of the primary or adjacent sites.

**Note 4:**  Assign T3 for localized tumor when no other information is available.
rows:
In situ, intraepithelial, noninvasive

Unknown; extension not stated
Primary tumor cannot be assessed
Not documented in patient record

Tumor limited to the epithelium and/or submucosa 
(mucosal disease)

Tumor confined to mucosa only:
    Glottis, NOS
    Intrinsic larynx
    Laryngeal commissure(s), anterior, posterior
    Vocal cord(s), NOS, true vocal cord(s), true cord(s)
WITH normal vocal cord mobility

Mucosal tumor confined to vocal cords

Extension involving mucosa only of adjacent region(s) of larynx:
   Subglottis
   Supraglottis:
       Aryepiglottic fold
       Arytenoid cartilage:
             Corniculate tubercle
             Cuneiform tubercle
      Ventricular bands (false vocal cord(s))

Extension involving mucosa only of adjacent regions:
    Base of tongue
    Hypopharynx, NOS
    Pre-epiglottic tissues
    Postcricoid area
    Pyriform sinus
    Vallecula

Localized, NOS

Stated as T3

Tumor invades deep soft tissue, cartilage, bone
or overlying skin

Involvement of deep tissues of any structures in T3
Involvement of any structures in T3 WITH impaired vocal cord mobility
Involvement of deep tissue or musculature of structures in T3 WITH or WITHOUT vocal impairment or fixation of larynx or NOS
Minor thyroid cartilage erosion (inner cortex)
Paraglottic space
Soft tissue, NOS

Extension to/through:
    Cricoid cartilage
    Thyroid cartilage except minor erosion
Extension to/through tissues beyond larynx:
    Oropharynx
    Skin
    Soft tissue of neck
    Strap muscles:
        Omohyoid
        Sternohyoid
        Sternothyroid
        Thyrohyoid
    Thyroid gland
    Trachea

Cervical esophagus
Deep extrinsic muscle(s) of tongue

Stated as T4a

Tumor invades any of the following:
Brain
Dura
Skull base
Lower cranial nerves (IX, X, XI, XII)
Masticator space
Carotid artery
Prevertebral space
Mediastinal structures

Contiguous extension, including:
    Carotid artery (encased)
    Mediastinal structures
   
Stated as T4b
